item.ItemType: Still ImagePhysical Dimensions: 1 v. ([6)] leaves) : col. ill. ; 13 x 18 cm + 1 notebook ([18] p. : ill. ; 11 cm)

Title.text: Paris. Detail of expanded peep show from the side

Description.text: A tunnel book, or peep show, that is part of an ongoing series of artists' books referencing old travel guidebooks and maps. This view of Paris is from the top floor of the Institut de Monde Arabe. The images were painted on pages from Les Guides Bleus published in 1952.

PhysicalDescription.text: Images were painted directly on guidebook pages, then offset printed and accordian bound on sides by hand. Number 397 from an edition of 500. Issued in an envelope, with a hand-painted "stamp" of Paris pasted onto the upper right corner.

RepositoryName.text: Avery Architectural and Fine Arts Library, Columbia University

item.ItemType: Still ImagePhysical Dimensions: 9 x 40 cm., in case 5 x 11 x 41 cm

Title.text: Arch. Detail of cutouts in pages

Description.text: Book consists of double sided, accordion-folded sections sewn together in pairs; illustrated with pop-ups and papercuts and is letterpress printed.
Paper architects: Jenny Karin Morrill; Ali Standish; Alycia Lang; Jennifer Wineke; Mandesha Marcus; Catherine Wang; Kathryn Hunt; Ilse Wogau; Jennifer Cohen, Winnie Ding.

PhysicalDescription.text: "This book was built by ten women paper architects. Their tools were knives and bone folders, and four Vandercook printing presses. They blended three typefaces ...: Garamond, Ehrhardt, and Fournier."--Colophon. In a clear acrylic slipcase as issued. Edition limited to 109 copies, signed by the artists.

RepositoryName.text: Avery Architectural and Fine Arts Library, Columbia University

item.ItemType: Still ImagePhysical Dimensions: 11 x 18 cm

Title.text: Masonic Temple New York City . Close-up of three cards

Description.text: Stereographs of the Masonic Temple located on the northeast corner of 23rd Street and 6th Avenue. The building was designed by N. Le Brun, its cornerstone laid on June 8th, 1870. The building was dedicated on June 2nd 1875.

PhysicalDescription.text: 26 photographic prints on stereo cards

RepositoryName.text: Avery Architectural and Fine Arts Library, Columbia University

item.ItemType: Still ImagePhysical Dimensions: Images 4 cm diameter, on mount 11 x 19 x 19 cm

Title.text: Saint Augustine, Florida. View of novelty from side

Description.text: Novelty format with lithographic illustrations

PhysicalDescription.text: Sixteen lithographic images are mounted in a structure which resembles a lotus flower or a standing rib roast. Each image is mounted on blue board with gold decoration, eight images in the upper half facing inward, eight in the lower half facing outward. In the center of the upper half is a color image of (local?) flora.

RepositoryName.text: Avery Architectural and Fine Arts Library, Columbia University

Title.text: Washington, D.C. : novelty format with lithographic illustrations. Detail of one of the building images

item.ItemType: Still ImagePhysical Dimensions: 16 leaves; each illustration 24 x 16 cm

Title.text: Model village for sand table and project work. Dutch Colonial house

Description.text: Unmade paper model in sheet form showing a model village. Each object is intended to be colored, cut out and mounted.

PhysicalDescription.text: One sheet of instructions, one sheet depicting a car, one sheet depicting accessories including a flag, a fountain and traffic signals, three sheets depicting people, and ten sheets depicting buildings including: a Studio, a Post Office, the Police and Fire Station, the Drugs Store, the Grocery Shop, a Hotel, a Church, a two Houses and a Bandstand.

RepositoryName.text: Avery Architectural and Fine Arts Library, Columbia University
